casebody.data:
State ex rel. Jackson, Appellant, v. McMonagle, Judge, Appellee.

[Cite as State ex rel. Jackson v. McMonagle (1993), 67 Ohio St.3d 450.]

(No. 93-959 Submitted August 16, 1993 Decided October 13, 1993.) *451 Theodore R. Jackson, Jr., pro se. Stephanie Tubb Jones, Cuyahoga County Prosecuting Attorney, and Elaine Welsh, Assistant Prosecuting Attorney, for appellee. Per Curiam.

The decision of the court of appeals is affirmed. Courts are not required to hold a hearing on all postconviction cases. R.C. 2953.21(C). Appeal is an adequate remedy at law. State ex rel. Kaldor v. Court of Common Pleas of Belmont Cty. (1984), 9 Ohio St.3d 114, 9 OBR 339, 459 N.E.2d 517.

Judgment affirmed.

Moyer, C.J., A.W. Sweeney, Douglas, Wright, Resnick, F.E. Sweeney and Pfeifer, JJ., concur.
